This page doesn't have any information about traffic shifting. It provides a high-level overview of namespaces.

Traffic shifting is a technique used to gradually migrate traffic from one version of a microservice to another. This is often used for canary deployments, where a new version of a service is rolled out to a small percentage of users before being rolled out to everyone. This allows you to test the new version in production with minimal impact if there are any issues.

For more information, see the Istio documentation on [Traffic Shifting](https://istio.io/latest/docs/tasks/traffic-management/traffic-shifting/).
